Plot: In 1965, three Mossad agents cross into East Berlin to apprehend a notorious Nazi war criminal. Thirty years later, the secrets the agents share come back to haunt them.
Title: The Debt
Writer: Matthew Vaughn (screenplay), Jane Goldman (screenplay), Peter Straughan (screenplay), Assaf Bernstein (film "Ha-Hov"), Ido Rosenblum (film "Ha-Hov")
Actors: Helen Mirren, Tom Wilkinson, Ciarán Hinds, Romi Aboulafia
tomatoConsensus: Its time-shifting narrative creates distracting casting problems, but ultimately, The Debt is a smart, well-acted entry in a genre that could use more like it.
